1.name: The Lady Vanishes
1.description: While travelling in continental Europe, a rich young playgirl realizes that an elderly lady seems to have disappeared from the train.

2.name: The Adventures of Robin Hood
2.description: When Prince John and the Norman Lords begin oppressing the Saxon masses in King Richard's absence, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel guerrilla army.

3.name: Bringing Up Baby
3.description: While trying to secure a $1 million donation for his museum, a befuddled paleontologist is pursued by a flighty and often irritating heiress and her pet leopard, Baby.

4.name: You Can't Take It with You
4.description: A man from a family of rich snobs becomes engaged to a woman from a good-natured but decidedly eccentric family.

5.name: Jezebel
5.description: In 1850s Louisiana, a free-spirited Southern belle loses her fiancé due to her stubborn vanity and pride, and vows to win him back.

6.name: Angels with Dirty Faces
6.description: A priest tries to stop a gangster from corrupting a group of street kids.

7.name: Holiday
7.description: A young man in love with a girl from a rich family finds his unorthodox plan to go on holiday for the early years of his life met with skepticism by everyone except for his fiancée's eccentric sister and long-suffering brother.

8.name: Pygmalion
8.description: A phonetics and diction expert makes a bet that he can teach a cockney flower girl to speak proper English and pass as a lady in high society.

9.name: Aleksandr Nevskiy
9.description: The story of how a great Russian prince led a ragtag army to battle an invading force of Teutonic Knights.

10.name: Love Finds Andy Hardy
10.description: Andy has problems raising the last payment for a used car and juggling three pretty girls with an upcoming country club dance scheduled.

11.name: Old Bones of the River
11.description: In this British comedy, a professor travels up river in Africa to open schools. But his new pupils are not receptive and when the commander of the local base succumbs to malaria, he takes ...                See full summary »

12.name: Algiers
12.description: Beautiful Gaby meets a romantic jewel thief in the mysterious Casbah.

13.name: La bête humaine
13.description: In this classic adaptation of Emile Zola's novel, a tortured train engineer falls in love with a troubled married woman who has helped her husband commit a murder.

14.name: Le quai des brumes
14.description: A military deserter finds love and trouble (and a small dog) in a smoky French port city.

15.name: A Christmas Carol
15.description: On Christmas Eve, an old miser named Ebenezer Scrooge is visited by the spirit of his former partner, Jacob Marley. The deceased partner was in his lifetime as mean and miserly as Scrooge ...                See full summary »

16.name: Boys Town
16.description: When a death row prisoner tells him he wouldn't have led a life of crime if only he had had one friend as a child, Father Edward Flanagan decides to do something about. An advocate of child...                See full summary »

17.name: Blondie
17.description: Dagwood loses his job on the eve of his and Blondie's fifth wedding anniversary.

18.name: The Terror
18.description: A mysterious criminal mastermind plots a spectacular gold robbery, then after the robbery is completed he makes sure his gang is caught by the police, keeps the gold and disappears. After ...                See full summary »

19.name: Marie Antoinette
19.description: The tragic life of Marie Antoinette, who became queen of France in her late teens.

20.name: The Dawn Patrol
20.description: British flying aces in World War I contend with the harsh realities of war.

21.name: The Rage of Paris
21.description: Nicole has no job and is several weeks behind with her rent. Her solution to her problem is to try and snare a rich husband. Enlisting the help of her friend Gloria and the maitre'd at a ...                See full summary »

22.name: Room Service
22.description: A penniless theatrical producer must outwit the hotel efficiency expert trying to evict him from his room, while securing a backer for his new play.

23.name: Love Is a Headache
23.description: A press agent for a Broadway actress whose career is going downhill, attempts to get her some publicity by having her adopt two orphans.

24.name: La femme du boulanger
24.description: A small village rejoices at the arrival of a new baker. But when his young wife runs off with another man, he is unable to keep baking and the village is thrown into disarray.

25.name: Nancy Drew: Detective
25.description: After a wealthy dowager who has made a substantial donation her alma mater suddenly disappears, Nancy Drew sets out to solve the mystery.

26.name: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
26.description: Rebecca's Uncle Harry leaves her with Aunt Miranda who forbids her to associate with show people. But neighbor Anthony Kent is a talent scout who secretly set it up for her to broadcast.

27.name: The Drum
27.description: During the British Raj, Captain Carruthers works under cover to track smuggled shipments of arms on the restless Northwest Frontier of India. He fears a full-scale rebellion is brewing. To ...                See full summary »

28.name: Four Daughters
28.description: Adam Lemp, the Dean of the Briarwood Music Foundation, has passed on his love of music to his four early adult daughters - Thea, Emma, Kay and Ann - who live with him and his sister, the ...                See full summary »

29.name: Test Pilot
29.description: Jim is a test pilot. His wife Ann and best friend Gunner try their best to keep him sober. But the life of a test pilot is anything but safe.

30.name: Block-Heads
30.description: Stan, who has remained faithfully at his World War I post for twenty years, finally comes home where his best friend, Ollie, takes him in, thus allowing him to discover the many conveniences of the modern world.

31.name: Carefree
31.description: A psychiatrist agrees to hypnotize his friend's girlfriend in order to convince her to accept his proposals of marriage, but she ends up falling for the psychiatrist instead.

32.name: A Yank at Oxford
32.description: A brash young American aristocrat attending Oxford University gets a chance to prove himself and win the heart of his antagonist's sister.

33.name: Vivacious Lady
33.description: A professor marries a nightclub singer, much to the consternation of his family and friends back home.

34.name: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
34.description: Tom Sawyer and his pal Huckleberry Finn have great adventures on the Mississippi River, pretending to be pirates, attending their own funeral and witnessing a murder.

35.name: Too Much Johnson
35.description: A woman has two lovers. When one man finds out about the other, he acts as a villain and chases after the protagonist.

36.name: Too Hot to Handle
36.description: Two rival newsreel photographers join forces to find the an aviatrix's missing brother, who has disappeared in the Amazon rainforest.

37.name: The Goldwyn Follies
37.description: Movie producer chooses a simple girl to be "Miss Humanity" and to critically evalute his movies from the point of view of the ordinary person. Hit song: "Love Walked In."

38.name: Swiss Miss
38.description: Stanley and Oliver are mousetrap salesmen hoping to strike it rich in Switzerland, but get swindled out of all their money by a cheesemaker. While working off their hotel debt, Oliver falls...                See full summary »

39.name: Flash Gordon's Trip to Mars
39.description: When a deadly Nitron ray strikes Earth, Flash Gordon and his friends travel to Mars to battle Ming the Merciless and his new ally Queen Azura.

40.name: Alexander's Ragtime Band
40.description: This send-up of ragtime song and dance begins in 1915 San Francisco when society boy Roger Grant decides to pursue popular rather than serious music.

41.name: The Divorce of Lady X
41.description: Divorce lawyer Everard Logan thinks the woman who spent the night in his hotel room is the erring wife of his new client.

42.name: The Lone Ranger
42.description: CHAP. 1, HI YO SILVER: An outlaw leader planning to take control of Texas after the Civil War kills Colonel Jeffries, a man empowered to levy taxes, and assumes his identity. His men then ...                See full summary »

43.name: Everybody Sing
43.description: Judy Bellaire, played by Judy Garland, is the center of trouble at her exclusive private and very conservative school. She is expelled when she starts singing in a Jazzy style in her music ...                See full summary »

44.name: Merrily We Live
44.description: Dizzy society matron Emily Kilbourne has a habit of hiring ex-cons and hobos as servants. Her latest find is a handsome "tramp" who shows up at her doorstep and soon ends up in a ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Mad Miss Manton
45.description: When the murdered body discovered by beautiful, vivacious socialite Melsa Manton disappears, police and press label her a prankster until she proves them wrong.

46.name: In Old Chicago
46.description: The O'Leary brothers -- honest Jack and roguish Dion -- become powerful figures, and eventually rivals, in Chicago on the eve of its Great Fire.

47.name: Child Bride
47.description: Schoolteacher in a rural community campaigns to stop the practice of older men marrying young, underage girls.

48.name: Three Comrades
48.description: A love story centered around the lives of three young German soldiers in the years following World War I. Their close friendship is strengthened by their shared love for the same woman who ...                See full summary »

49.name: The Great Waltz
49.description: In 1845 Vienna, Johann Strauss II - Schani to his friends - would rather write and perform waltzes than anything else, this at a time when a waltz is not considered proper society music. ...                See full summary »

50.name: Hôtel du Nord
50.description: A young couple, Renee and Pierre, take one night a room at the Hotel du Nord, in Paris, near the canal Saint-Martin. They want to die together, but after having shooted at Renee, Pierre ...                See full summary »
